rationale: Both fields indicate the version of the schema used for validation, but in the target schema, it is represented by a specific identifier format.
Both fields represent a free-text description of the assay, and the descriptions are identical.
The source field represents the ID of the donor, while the target field is broader, representing the sample (which can come from multiple donors or tissues).
No direct equivalent found in the target schema for this specific tissue identifier.
No field in the target schema specifically captures the assay start date and time.
Both fields represent the DOI of protocols used, but the target field is focused on sample preparation rather than the entire assay.
No corresponding field in the target schema for the operator of the assay.
No corresponding field in the target schema for the operator's email.
No corresponding field in the target schema for the principal investigator's name.
No corresponding field in the target schema for the principal investigator's email.
No equivalent found in the target schema for categorizing the assay into predefined types.
Both fields capture the specific type of dataset or assay being performed, and the values match.
Both fields capture the class of analytes being measured, with identical definitions.
Both fields specify whether a specific molecule is being targeted in the assay, and they have the same intent.
Both fields represent the vendor of the instrument used for acquisition, and the descriptions match exactly.
Both fields describe the model of the acquisition instrument used, with matching intents.
Both fields capture the number of antibodies used in the assay, with identical meaning.
Both fields capture the number of fluorescent channels imaged during each cycle, with identical intent.
No direct equivalent field in the target schema for the number of cycles.
Both fields capture the total number of imaging rounds, but the target field also includes autofluorescence/background acquisitions.
No corresponding field in the target schema capturing the width of a pixel.
No corresponding field in the target schema for the unit of measurement of pixel width.
No corresponding field in the target schema capturing the height of a pixel.
No corresponding field in the target schema for the unit of measurement of pixel height.
No direct equivalent found in the target schema for the processing protocol DOI.
No direct equivalent field in the target schema for an overall protocol DOI.
Both fields capture the file path to the antibodies information, with identical definitions.
Both fields capture the file path to the contributors' ORCID IDs, with identical definitions.
Both fields capture the file path or directory with the instrument data, with identical definitions.
